conclusion: An ideal gas undergoes a cyclic process with steps A to B, B to C, and C to A. Temperature at state A is 200 K.
The p-V diagram has volume on the x-axis (liters) and pressure on the y-axis (10^5 Pa). Points A, B, and C are marked.
Point A is at (2 L, 1 × 10^5 Pa).
Point B is at (2 L, 4 × 10^5 Pa).
Point C is at (5 L, 1 × 10^5 Pa).

premise: Process A to B is a vertical line on the p-V diagram.
conclusion: Process A to B is at constant volume (2 L).

premise: Process B to C is a straight line decreasing from B to C.
conclusion: Process B to C has decreasing pressure and increasing volume.

premise: Process C to A is a horizontal line on the p-V diagram.
conclusion: Process C to A is at constant pressure (1 × 10^5 Pa).
Work done by the gas in a process is given by W = ∫P dV.

premise: Process A to B is at constant volume.
conclusion: No work is done in process A to B (W_AB = 0).

premise: Process B to C is a straight line on the p-V diagram.
conclusion: Pressure can be expressed as a linear function of volume: P = mV + b.

premise: Points B(2 L, 4 × 10^5 Pa) and C(5 L, 1 × 10^5 Pa) are given.
Using point B to find y-intercept.
Pressure function derived: P(V) = (-1 × 10^5 Pa/L) V + 6 × 10^5 Pa.
conclusion: Work done from B to C: W_BC = ∫(2 to 5) (-1 × 10^5 V + 6 × 10^5) dV.
